TopicTitle: EVA performed in versions prior to 0.16?

Articles.Content:
As you all know, Kerbal EVA was added in 0.16, replacing the old three-kerbal Mk1 Pod with the new one-kerbal Mk1 Pod with EVA capabilities.

However, those two pictures depict a Kerbal performing an EVA with a ship using the older three-kerbal Mk1 Pod, at a version seemingly older than 0.15.

What is this witchcraft?
Probably the devs testing EVA before releasing 0.15

Probably the devs testing EVA before releasing 0.15

*0.16

It seems like witchcraft, but I'm guessing it's just copying and pasting assets into a older version.
Those are pictures from Harvester's dev blag (yes, blag. Not blog
some one released a old part mod pack
Someone released the old part recently for 0.23
Awww look at all the new members. They're so adorable.

Ah, good ol' Mk1 pod. It saw me go from stacking SRBs and firing them all at the same time, to landing on the Mun using decouplers and fins.

Now get off my lawn!

Ah, good ol' Mk1 pod. It saw me go from stacking SRBs and firing them all at the same time, to landing on the Mun using decouplers and fins.

Now get off my lawn!

Those were the days... One's Munar landing depended upon the structural integrity of four fins...
these are dev pics back from when 0.16 was about to be released, I remember drooling over them back when there was still a separate forum for developer updates

The new pods were added in .16, they were designed around the entire size of the kerbals because they ended up being to small that they had insect physics. So they made the Kerbals 1 meter tall, and redesigned the pods.

they were designed around the entire size of the kerbals because they ended up being to small that they had insect physics

What does that mean? Sorry if I'm being dense...

The old pods were 1 meter wide, but making Kerbals small enough to fit 3 to a pod caused Unity to freak out, so the old pod was replaced with a one Kerbal pod, we gained a 3 Kerbal pod, 1 meter became 1.25 meters and a Kerbal with helmet was made 1 meter tall to avoid Unity issues.

And that's why parts are a funny size
